thread.title: First look: The new singles cabins planned for Cunard's Queen Mary 2
thread.title_full: First look: The new singles cabins planned for Cunard's Queen Mary 2

title: First look: The new singles cabins planned for Cunard's Queen Mary 2
text:
An artist's drawing of one of 15 new singles cabins that will be added to Cunard's Queen Mary 2 in an overhaul planned for 2016. Cunard Line Fullscreen Six of the 15 singles cabins that will be added to the Queen Mary 2 will be larger than the rest with wide built-in console. Cunard Line Fullscreen Britannia Club Balcony cabins on the Queen Mary 2 also will feature soft tones with imperial blue and gold accents. Cunard Line Fullscreen An artist's drawing of the new look planned for the Queens Grill suites on Cunard's Queen Mary 2. Cunard Line Fullscreen An artist's drawing of the new look planned for the Princess Grill suites on Cunard's Queen Mary 2. Cunard Line Fullscreen An artist's drawing of the new look planned for the Queens Grill restaurant on Cunard's Queen Mary 2. Cunard Line Fullscreen An artist's drawing of the new look planned for the Princess Grill restaurant on Cunard's Queen Mary 2. Cunard Line Fullscreen The new configurations planned for Queens Grill suites on Cunard's Queen Mary 2. Cunard Line Fullscreen Cunard's Queen Mary 2 arrives in New York on July 14, 2015. Diane Bondareff, AP Images for Cunard Cunard's Queen Mary 2 arrives in New York on July 14, 2015. (Photo: Diane Bondareff, AP Images for Cunard)
48 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE The new singles cabins that Cunard is adding to the Queen Mary 2 in 2016 will feature soft tones contrasted with rich imperial blue and gold highlights, the line revealed Tuesday.
As can be seen in the newly released artist's drawings in the carousel above, the 15 rooms will be custom-designed for solo travelers with a single bed, small seating area and desk.
Among little touches, the cabins will have a contemporary carpet pattern inspired by the geometric diamond designs seen on Cunard's original Queen Mary.
Announced in July , the singles cabins will be added during a major, 25-day makeover of the Queen Mary 2 that begins in May.
USA TODAY
New singles cabins debut on Cunard's Queen Victoria
Nine of the singles cabins will be on Deck 2 and six larger single cabins will be Deck 3L.
Cunard on Tuesday also revealed the new look for the Queen Mary 2's Britannia Club Balcony cabins, which are being revamped during the makeover. The ship also is getting an additional 30 Britannia Club Balcony cabins during the overhaul. As can be seen in the carousel above, the rooms will feature a similar decor as the new singles cabins with imperial blue and gold accents.
Christened by the UK's Queen Elizabeth II in 2004, the Queen Mary 2 was the first ocean liner built for trans-Atlantic crossings since the debut of the Queen Elizabeth 2 in 1969. At nearly 150,000 tons, it was the largest passenger vessel in the world at the time of its unveiling and still ranks among the top ten largest passenger ships. It holds 2,620 passengers at double occupancy.
Cunard this year is celebrating its 175th anniversary with a series of events involving the Queen Mary 2 including a historic meet-up with its two sister vessels, Queen Victoria and Queen Elizabeth, in Liverpool, England. Scroll through the carousel below for a look at the three vessels together:
Cunard's three 'queens' -- Queen Mary 2, Queen Victoria and Queen Elizabeth -- sailed together into Liverpool, England for the first time on May 25, 2015. James D. Morgan Fullscreen The rendezvous of the Queen Mary 2, Queen Victoria and Queen Elizabeth in Liverpool on May 25, 2015 was part of a citywide celebration of Cunard's 175th anniversary. The line long was based in the city. James D. Morgan Fullscreen Hundreds of thousands of spectators lined the banks of Liverpool's Mersey River on May 25 to witness Cunard's three ships sail into the city. James D. Morgan Fullscreen Thousands of spectators surround the waterfront of Liverpool as Cunard's three 'queens' arrive. James D. Morgan Fullscreen Cunard's Queen Mary 2, Queen Victoria and Queen Elizabeth sailing into Liverpool on May 25, 2015. James D. Morgan Fullscreen Queen Mary 2, Queen Victoria and Queen Elizabeth meet in the Mersey, Liverpool for a gathering in front of the Three Graces and thousands of people on the riverside. James D. Morgan Fullscreen Spectators filled the waterfront area in front of Liverpool's 'three graces" -- the Royal Liver Building, Cunard Building and Port of Liverpool Building. James D.
